item.title: Cheat Client Help
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

The input one i know thats basicly means if i am in the server and i am typing : that will do that code and i know how to use ints
but i didn’t understand this:
1.How can i know wich one to use writeWord OR writeByte OR writeString and you know all the stream class methods.
2.I didn’t acctually understand what’s make you restore your prayer.
3.Only if you can explain because i didn’t found something about this: what this means “>>” in java

Another question if ill add a new case into the server packets method lets say money pouch and then ill want to use that case in another method can i do in that method
createFrame(moneyPouchCaseID); ?
and how can i know what to use (inStream./outStream.)
Really thank you for helping me understand this.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheat Client Help
item.dc:creator: @Kiryn Kiryn
item.description:
@Kiryn wrote:

Host Gushers:

thanks for explaining it man, u think u can help me add a dupe?

I’m working on a new project at the moment, but a dupe would be difficult to add. You would have to look for a popular base and dig through it hardcore. Just to find a function without an item quantity check. Then you would have to create fake packet itself in the client. I would recommend creating something simpler first.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheat Client Help
item.dc:creator: @Kiryn Kiryn
item.description:
@Kiryn wrote:

Host Gushers:

Thank you for replying, can u please explain the code for me? aswell as i think if i packet spoof i could do something?

if (inputString.equals("::p")) { // Restores prayer int i1 = (myPlayer.x - 6 >> 7) + baseX; int j2 = (myPlayer.y - 6 >> 7) + baseY; stream.createFrame(132); stream.method433(i1); stream.writeWord(409); stream.method432(j2); }

Okay, hopefully you understand the input part so moving on:

int i1 = (myPlayer.x - 6 >> 7) + baseX; int j2 = (myPlayer.y - 6 >> 7) + baseY; These are variable declarations. They get your current X and current Y postion

stream.createFrame(132); stream.method433(i1); stream.writeWord(409); stream.method432(j2);

The first line: stream.createFrame(132);
Sends the packet 132 to the server. For 317 sources, packet 132 is clicking on an object.

this second line: stream.method433(i1);
Is packet information. (Each packet has required information that needs to be sent along with the packet) All this does is tell the server there is an object on your current location (because of the variable declared earlier)

This third line: stream.writeWord(409);
Is telling the server what object your clicking on. The object we clicked on is 409 (Prayer altar)

This fourth line: stream.method432(j2);
Is the X-Coordinate for the packet information needed (and earlier we told the server it was right where we were standing)

So in a summary we tell the server that we clicked an prayer altar where we are standing and it restores our prayer

heres a link with all the packets that cant be sent to the server, what they do, and what information is needed: http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=317_Protocol#Client_-.3E_Server_Packets

Read full topic

item.title: Cheat Client Help
item.dc:creator: @Kiryn Kiryn
item.description:
@Kiryn wrote:

Hello I’m Kiryn, one of the creators of emerald dream. (My other account is error1a).

The reason there is no item command because the creator of Insidia put item checks when packets are sent. It is still possible to spawn items. You just have to be creative. Also if you would like me to explain the command you posted I will be happy to do so

Read full topic

item.title: Cheat Client Help
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

I want to add a item command to emeralds cheat client, ive found out u add them in client.java, here is how one of the current crazy command looks like

					if (inputString.equals("::p")) { // Restores prayer
						int i1 = (myPlayer.x - 6 >> 7) + baseX;
						int j2 = (myPlayer.y - 6 >> 7) + baseY;
						stream.createFrame(132);
						stream.method433(i1);
					    stream.writeWord(409);
						stream.method432(j2);
					}

can someone help me make a item one?

Read full topic
